Title: â†©ï¸ ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ - Ukrainian outlet, Kiev Independent, confirms Trump'...
Description: Rerum Novarum // Intel, Breaking News, and Alerts: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦âš¡- Trump's team hold secret talks with Zelenskyâ€™s Ukrainian opposition. The talks were held with Yulia Tymoshenko, a Ukrainian political veteran, and Petro Poroshenko, former Ukrainian President. ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ - Ukrainian outlet, Kiev Independent, confirms Trump's team held secret talks with Ukrainian opposition figures on holding elections, in a bid to remove Zelensky from power.The talks were held with former Prime Minister, Yulia Tymoshenko, a veteran of Ukrainian politics. Tymoshenko belongs to the Batkivshchyna, a far-right conservative party. The party is far more anti-Russia than Zelensky's Servant of the Peoples Party.Trump's team also spoke with Poroshenko, the former President of Ukraine, and post-Maidan President. Poroshenko's popularity in Ukraine plummeted after the 'Roshen Chocolate Company' scandal. Poroshenko's government was believed to have been influenced by Ukraine's far-right sectors, which was evident by several appointments he had made. Such as Azov-linked Avakov as Interior Minister, and Troyan as Kiev's Chief of Police (a former Azov Commander). Both figures are unpopular, and unlikely to replace Zelensky in an election. With the only real candidate of succeeding Zelensky being Zaluzhny. Zaluzhny will end up proving more difficult to negotiate with than Zelensky. The US witnessed Zaluzhny's stubbornness during Ukraine's '2023 Counteroffensive', when Zaluzhny blasted NATO's tactics as 'obsolete' after multiple failed attacks. Instead launched his own tactics, and saw mild success.All three opposition figures have rejected calls for an early election in Ukraine.

Title: â†©ï¸ ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ - Dubinsky, an independent, was previously part of Zelens...
Description: Rerum Novarum // Intel, Breaking News, and Alerts: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦âš¡- BREAKING: Oleksandr Dubinsky, Ukrainian Rada Deputy, in an address to the Rada Speaker demands to begin the impeachment of President Zelensky. ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ - Dubinsky, an independent, was previously part of Zelensky's Servant of the People Party. Dubinsky, while working for '1+1 Channel', offered a very positive coverage of Zelensky in the lead-up to the 2019 elections. The two have since fallen out over Dubinsky's strong opposition towards the Ukrainian far-right and over Dubinsky's ties to Ihor Kolomoyskyi.Note, Kolomoyskyi, a former Ukrainian-Israeli oligarch, was stripped of his Ukrainian citizenship by Zelensky. Kolomoyskyi had long been accused corruption and of forming and financing anti-Maidan units in 2014, such as the 'Dnepr Gangs', which clashed with Azov on several occasions. Several Azov-linked politicians (such as Interior Minister Avakov) led for the nationalization of Kolomoyskyi's PrivatBank. Kolomoyskyi took the Poroshenko government to court in return. Title: â†©ï¸ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ - Kurakhovo direction update: Russian forces have b...
Description: Rerum Novarum // Intel, Breaking News, and Alerts: Photo ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ - Kurakhovo direction update:Russian forces have begun clearing the Kurakhovo pocket, however reports of the pocket being completely cleared are false. A source from the Russian 68th Tank Brigade tells Rerum Novarum that they are still waiting along the outskirts of Dachnoe, as small Ukrainian pockets remain in the trenches and tree-lines west of the town.Front-line sources, from Ukraine and Russia, state that the trapped Ukrainian personnel in the Kurakhovo pocket, west of Dachnoe, might be the infamous and very well experienced Ukrainian 79th Brigade 'Cyborgs'. This report remains unconfirmed at the moment.Reports of Russian forces capturing the entirety of Ulakly are pure fiction. A source from the Russian 38th Brigade, the very unit that's fighting there, tells Rerum Novarum that they just managed to position themselves in the southern outskirts of the town.Russian forces stormed Konstantinopol from the south early morning, creating a landing platform in the southeast of the town. Russian forces have also successfully crossed the Volcha river and are pressuring the Ukrainian force in the town from the north too.In Andreevka, battles continue in the west of the town. 80% of the large town is under Russian control, but sources tell Rerum Novarum that advancing here has become difficult as Ukrainian forces have destroyed most infrastructure, including the houses. Russian units are instead focusing on the large trench network north of the town.
